headline: I partner with small business owners & leaders to reduce overwhelm, fix broken processes & streamline operations so they can build strong teams & grow profit with simple, scalable systems & greater organizational clarity
summary: From a young age, I‚Äôve had an innate desire to help people. Whether it was identifying problems when no one else was looking, asking the probing questions that every parent dreads, or offering solutions‚Äîsometimes unsolicited‚ÄîI was always driven to make things better. If you had asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up, my answers would have included lawyer, police officer, or doctor. As I got older, I knew those weren't right for me. My career journey has taken me through various sectors, including small to medium-sized businesses, the service industry, a lobbying firm in Washington D.C., a mega-church, and local government. In each organization, I consistently sought to understand the challenges at hand. I asked questions, identified issues, and proposed solutions‚Äîsome welcomed, others less so. Regardless of the setting, my focus remained on finding the most strategic and logical paths forward. This involved refining existing processes and systems. One recurring theme across all these organizations was a lack of clarity in management and leadership. Employees often struggled with unclear expectations, resulting in low morale and plenty of ‚Äúwater cooler‚Äù conversations post-meetings. Furthermore, genuine people development was frequently overlooked. Through my diverse work experiences and education, I discovered the sweet spot where my skills and passions intersected. Today, I have the privilege of helping businesses transform their operations and cultures. I collaborate closely with business owners to diagnose their challenges and craft tailored growth strategies. The best part? They define what success looks like for them, and together we build a roadmap to achieve it. Are You Facing These Challenges? ‚è© Is your business growing but you're unsure how to sustain that momentum? ‚è© Is your team not performing at the level you know they can? ‚è© Are you bogged down by a lack of clarity and ineffective processes that hinder your growth? ‚è© Are you tired of feeling overwhelmed as a business owner or CEO and longing for more balance in your life? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, I want to invite you into a conversation. This initial conversation will help us diagnose the issues within your business and identify actionable strategies you can implement right away. company: Fresno County Women's Chamber of Commerce
company_description: The Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce was originally established as a committee within an organization. Women served on some committees but, were not allowed to hold office and did not have voting privileges. Because women were paid lower salaries in those days, most women could not afford to join the Greater Fresno Area Chamber of Commerce. In 1950, that all changed. Martha McKinley received permission from the President of the Chamber to form a ‚ÄúWomen‚Äôs Section‚Äù, with dues more affordable to the working women of that time. They were to have their own Officers and Bylaws. For the next 40 years, the Women‚Äôs Section acted as a support group for the Chamber. In 1990 it was time for a change and thus evolved the Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce, a 501(c)(6) organization. Our mission is to provide and promote professional opportunities, personal development, financial growth, community leadership and legislative awareness for women. We believe in supporting each other and watching our members‚Äô successes. By encouraging others to do business with fellow members, members see their business and friendships grow. Inspiring you: To think differently To discover something new To meet new people To play a greater role in our community To discover new ways to help your business grow
previous_job_description: All businesses hit bumps in the road or come across bottlenecks. These are the things that stop you from moving your business forward. Sometimes this is around processes, sometimes around marketing or your funnel, sometimes this is around the way the organization is structured, and sometimes it is a management/leadership issue. The reality is, processes and people have an impact on the profit in your business. I help small to medium size businesses strategically increase their leads, sales, and revenue. We work together to discover what is holding you back from making the revenue you want in your business, establishing a plan, and then execute it. I also help turn managers into leaders. There is a difference in the two and once a manager starts acting as a leader, the organization will begin to see an increase in productivity, employee engagement, and profits. Discover your preferred leadership style, how to motivate employees, discover how your core values relate to your leadership values and your organization, and make a bigger impact in your organization. My job is to help you establish strategies that align with your companies vision and mission to thrive. Every business hits roadblocks, it‚Äôs how you decide to move forward that makes all the difference. If you are stuck, let‚Äôs connect.

headline: I transform struggling leaders by helping them develop, evolve, and find their way from sucKcess to success. Top 100 Thought Leader in Leadership & Global 100 Executive Coach of the Year. Multi-Award-Winning PodcasterüéôÔ∏è
summary: I am a leadership, Management, and Career developer because I know what it feels like not to have a good leader early in my career. I was surrounded by leaders in the wrong positions and people in positions of authority who had no business being there. I want to give people who are considering leadership, those in leadership who are struggling, and executives who are over their heads an opportunity to develop before they hurt someone or themselves. I want to see the day when workers do not have to go home and consume their dinner and talk about the underdeveloped and unprepared leaders they work for. Do you know the leader I am talking about or is that you? Ok, so here is all the other stuff people want to see: I am a Best-selling author of A Lion's Pride: The Scars That Silenced Kings, and I co-authored Voices for Leadership: Your Pathway to Becoming a More Influential Leader, The Latino Leadership Playbook, and Latinos 100. I have served as an Executive, Business Owner, Veteran & Advocate, Board Member, Non-Profit Administrator, Speaker, Mentor, Coach, and Avid Volunteer. Over the past 30 years, I have held numerous executive advisor and senior positions while serving in the United States Navy and civilian sector. Through education and training, I helped strengthen the chain of command and businesses, providing sound decision support and creating open communication at all levels. I also helped formulate and implement policies concerning morale, welfare, job satisfaction, discipline, and training of Navy and civilian personnel. My performance won me the Meritorious Service Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal. I was named 2013, 2014, and 2017 Mentor of the Year, and recipient of the inaugural 2014 Chief John Dungan Jr. Oceanographer of the Navy Award. I was also awarded The Arnold Fletcher Award and inducted into the SALUTE National honors society for my academic achievements. I volunteer actively for various projects and non-profits, earning the esteemed Bronze, Silver, and Gold President‚Äôs Volunteer Service Award. I host the Award-Winning Developing the Leader Within Podcast. On the DTLW Podcast, I share real-world leadership lessons shaped by my personal experiences, challenges, and victories. Having overcome significant obstacles, including 26 years of Naval service, I know what it takes to lead with resilience and authenticity. Tune in for insights on leadership, growth, thriving in adversity, and entrepreneurship, whether you're leading a team or just leading your life.

headline: Global Speaker * M&A Whisperer * #1 M&A Speaker/Consultant * HBR & Forbes Contributor * Author * MG100 * TEDx Speaker * Parkinson‚Äôs Caregiver
summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". The title comes from my work advising leaders and organizations on the "unexpected people challenges" of Mergers & Acquisitions. The challenges that can doom a deal but which rarely get covered in M&A preparedness training. I've been on all sides of the deal equation and show leaders what it takes to lead people through change and uncertainty. My leadership lessons came as an international C-Suite executive leading teams through three separate multibillion-dollar deals. I learned firsthand that M&A growth strategies suffer when leaders haven‚Äôt been prepared to guide their teams through the emotional roller-coaster that can occur post-deal. No wonder people struggle to pivot and adapt as quickly as management expects. These insights and lessons were captured in my best-selling M&A business book, "NOW WHAT? A Survivor‚Äôs Guide for Thriving Through Mergers & Acquisitions" which serves as a playbook for executives and handbook for frontline leaders balancing their day job with post-deal integration work. My M&A consultancy, Day1 Ready was founded on the premise that M is for Mindset and A is for Agile. Through one-day workshops and keynotes, I‚Äôve prepared hundreds of CEOs, executives and middle managers to recognize that success in M&A is not solely achieved by following static playbooks; success comes from having an adaptive mindset and an agile approach. Speaking on human capital strategies that drive M&A success, I‚Äôve guest lectured at the University of Chicago/Booth School of Business, Northwestern, and Thunderbird School of Global Management. I write a business leadership column for Forbes and contribute to Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, and Inc. Honored as Entrepreneur of the Year by Northshore Women in Business in 2019, I was recently ranked the #1 M&A Leadership Consultant by Leadership Research Institute and nominated to Thinkers50 2024 Radar list of future management thinkers to watch. Expertise: transition strategist; integration planning and execution; culture assimilation; change management; change communications; M&A on-boarding/off-boarding; brand identity and strategy; B2B marketing and communications Pursuing an M&A deal? headline: Unlocking Clarity & Impact Through Integrative Coaching
summary: Are you a leader, social entrepreneur, or creative professional feeling disconnected from your purpose, struggling to balance impact with personal well-being, or finding yourself stuck in old patterns? Do you find your team stuck in old patterns, rehashing past challenges instead of moving towards a more generative future? As a social entrepreneur, are you struggling to align your deep values with your daily actions, and find a clear path to making the impact you desire? At Heyman Partners, we understand these challenges. We help leaders, social entrepreneurs, and creative professionals move past these obstacles to achieve impact with joy through integrated growth and aligned purpose. We guide individuals and organizations to the sweet spot where they can make a real difference while maintaining a deep sense of fulfillment. I've worked with many leaders who, while managing people and resources, guiding strategy and implementation, and confronting disagreement, sometimes neglect their own internal boundaries, leading to overwhelm and burnout. I've also learned that while occasionally rehashing "war stories" can be instructive, focusing on those times can keep you and your team stuck in the past, rather than moving towards a generative future. In my work, I help my clients learn to develop healthy boundaries, shift away from trauma bonds, and move forward with generative energy. Here‚Äôs what some of my clients say: ‚ÄúI threw out a number of goals and within 20 minutes we had compelling and inspiring direction.‚Äù ‚ÄúShe has twice lead out team in decision making that enabled us to thrive and grow as an organization.‚Äù ‚ÄúShe could cut to the heart of an issue and help us find our way there, and also a path forward.‚Äù Are you or your team ready to discover your sweet spot where impact and joy intersect? We believe that clarity of purpose, quality of interaction, and aligned action can transform your work and life, leading to more sustainable and generative outcomes. If you are ready to bring joy and fulfillment back into your work, and align your values and actions for a greater impact, visit my website in my profile section to learn more about our integrative approach to growth and how we can help you find your sweet spot.

headline: Startup Strategist | Founder Performance Coach | Venture Design Trainer
summary: The founder makes the difference. Same idea, same market, similar traction‚Äîinvestors bet on the founder who can navigate extreme uncertainty without getting lost in the sauce. This is not trivial. Your job is hard. You're searching for a business model in a particular market that's never been built before, making strategic decisions without clear answers, designing a future company while staying grounded in present reality.Doing this competently requires a specific skillset that most people have never developed. It's about developing the capabilities to search systematically, design strategically, and make grounded decisions when there's no obvious path forward.I have been a founder performance coach for 11 years. I work with pre-seed through Series A founders who are playing the long game, building companies that matter. I help you develop those skills‚Äîusing a venture design framework that gives you structure for the search, context for prioritization, and confidence in your decisions.

headline: The Strategy Accelerator - I help CEOs accelerate strategy for results. Follow for Strategic Leadership. | CEO @ Enactive Strategy ‚Ä¢ ex-BCG Partner ‚Ä¢ ex-Industrial Tech CEO ‚Ä¢ 37,000+ strategic followers
summary: I help CEOs and executives move from being ‚Äúoperators who get things done‚Äù to being ‚Äúleaders who create advantage and lasting impact.‚Äù Who are you? Mid-level and senior executives who‚Äôve been told they ‚Äúneed to be more strategic.‚Äù Leaders who are strong operators but struggle to make the shift into strategic roles. Organizations that want their managers at all levels to think and act more strategically, not just execute. New CEOs and executives inheriting entrenched strategies who need to reshape thinking across their teams. 2. What keeps you up at night? Fear of being seen as ‚Äúnot strategic enough‚Äù and getting sidelined or even laid off. Overloaded agendas where everything feels urgent but little feels truly strategic. Frustration with plans that don‚Äôt move the organization forward‚Äîlots of initiatives, little impact. The weight of uncertainty and complexity‚Äînoise, turbulence, and competing priorities. Worry about losing influence, missing opportunities, or being blindsided by disruption. 3. What have you tried? Reading strategy books or attending planning-heavy courses that explain what strategy is but not how to be strategic. summary: Focused on ‚ÄúImpact with Integrity‚Äù, Dr. Mah is the Chairwoman & Founder of Stella Foundation, a national conSTELLAtion of organizations and leaders walking alongside womxn-led businesses from startup to sale and the funders who champion them; founding member of Stella Angels, a female angel investment group; Investment Committee member of Next Wave Impact, a social impact venture fund; an angel investor to over 160+ startups who have diverse founders on the leadership team and 15+ emerging fund managers who invest in new paradigms of innovation & impact, and a founding partner of Ad Astra Ventures, that aims to invest in conscious capital resilient founders. headline: President & CEO - Management Consultant - Professional Development Leader - Executive Coach
summary: As an Organizational Development Consultant, Professional Development Leader, and Executive Coach, Phil has led programs across HR, Operations, Talent, Enterprise, and IT groups, as well as helping C-Suite Executives realize their greatest potential. He has developed best practice consulting solutions, delivered customized training programs, and facilitated executive coaching sessions for global clients such as JP Morgan, Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, The Hartford, NASA, MIT Lincoln Labs, Pfizer/Pharmacia, Merck, Phillips Petroleum, Walmart, BCBS, Prudential, The Hanover, AT&T, Genzyme and many others. Some of his direct contributions range from strategy development, Agile/digital transformation, innovation & strategic planning, performance management, learning & development structure development, talent management, globalization, servant leadership, culture development, and integrated quality workflow design. Phil has designed models such as the REST Leadership Framework, the 4x4 Instructional Design Structure, the Bridge Selling System, as well as foundational processes to support Dynamic Learning Tracks, Business Simulation Training, and a L&D foundational infrastructure called the Learning Academy. As a serial Entrepreneur, Phil founded AMS Aviation, PTV Equity and WIT Marine Group. Phil maintains an active role in PTV Equity as the CIO with direct oversight responsibility for venture funding and asset class/equity portfolio analysis & trade execution. As an Industry Thought Leader, Phil maintains an active presence in associations, is a sought-out speaker, as well as publishing on Organizational Development topics. Phil has contributed as an adjunct faculty and/or guest lecturer at Boston University, University of Massachusetts-Boston, California State University-Hayward, and is a regular contributor to the Business Ethics curricular at Suffolk University Sawyer Business School. Phil earned his BSBA and M.B.A. with a concentration in Organizational Development, from Lasselle and Northeastern University, holds a Master Certificate in Project Management from Boston University, and an Advanced Leadership Accreditation from the University of New Hampshire. Additionally, Phil, holds accreditations from industry associations such as PMI, ASTD, and SHRM. Phil is a commercially rated pilot, and among other interests, is an offshore yachtsman, adventure motorcycle enthusiast, backcountry skier, golfer, aspiring guitarist, and global citizen with a flair for wanderlust, having traveled the world in pursuit of adventure and cultural fulfilment.

headline: Founder and President of Newpoint - Specializing in Turnaround Consulting for Small Businesses/LMM | Partnering with Banks, CPAs, and Legal Professionals to Revitalize $5MM‚Äì$50MM Companies
summary: WHAT I DO: For more than 35 years and over 600 engagements, I have rapidly helped companies with revenue $5MM to $50MM fix their cash flow and plan cash flow and operations changes for future profitability. Even small businesses can be complex. I help owners and managers understand the cash flow impact of their decisions and actions to ensure optimal operations that lead to good cash flow. In that effort, not only have I been a consultant (now CTP), I have been named a Chapter 11 Trustee, Federal and State Receiver and Assignee. HOW I DO IT: The Newpoint team and I help you create cash flow forecasts and budgets using Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢. We teach owners and managers how to manage cash on their own, but we also deploy our proprietary diagnostic tool (TAME‚Ñ¢) to help with the changes you need to make to ensure your business becomes stronger. Access to TAME‚Ñ¢ trained professionals makes sure you are seeing what you need to make the right decisions for your business. WHY IT WORKS: When you partner with Newpoint, you get the most efficient, effective, and affordable turnaround help. Our ROI is a verified 2700% for owners and stakeholders. WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT: Our Cash Flow Coach‚Ñ¢ program and our other services are provided on a fixed-fee/fixed-time basis, so you know what it is going to cost beforehand. The tools are designed for rapid deployment, so you can get answers fast (120 Days+)‚Äì because that is what you need. Our proprietary TAME‚Ñ¢ company diagnostic tool with 120 questions and industry best-in-class benchmarking takes the emotions out of the introspection about your business and is designed for rapid deployment ‚Äì again, because that is what you need. These tools have been tested with hundreds of companies like yours. Since founding Newpoint in 2013, CFL‚Ñ¢ and TAME‚Ñ¢ have been able to help financiers recover $1,620,000,000 in debt and saved 14,731 jobs. NEXT STEP: Can we help you? 800-306-1250 kyager@newpointadvisors.us www.newpointadvisors.us

job_title: Founder and President - Financial Advisors to Small Distressed Companies and Stakeholder
job_description: WHY IT MATTERS: Cash flow is the life-blood of your business. When you struggle with cash flow, it is often due to a lack of understanding about how your business decisions are impacting cash or you have a sense you have tried everything. Frustration leads to doubt and a business suffers as a result. Our clients are the size companies that hire the majority of people and pay most of the taxes in this country. However, these companies do not have consistent access to professional cash flow management that would help them in a time of need. That is where Newpoint comes in. CASE STUDY: Often companies are sent to us when they are in significant trouble. Our job is to move quickly to give them visibility to the issues and come up with viable solutions. We have worked with hundreds of companies that faced game changing decisions, like one mid-west based machine shop. They had been around for years, but since economic turmoil and some personal matters came up, they had not been able to turn a profit. Their lender was fatigued, but not totally ready to give up. We were able to work with management over a two week period of time, put together a Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢ tool that showed where quick changes would solve the immediate issues. The result - their lender stuck with them. TAME‚Ñ¢ helped management see where some longer term changes would make them stronger. The rapid deployment of Newpoint's Proprietary Cash Flow Launcher coupled with professional insight from TAME‚Ñ¢ gave the company the tools to see in days what they had not been able to clear up for several years. STATISTICS: Since founding Newpoint in 2013, CFL‚Ñ¢ and TAME‚Ñ¢ have been able to help financiers recover $1,355,000,000 in debt and saved 13,414 jobs. WHAT I DO: cash flow coaching, turnaround consulting, turnaround management, change company outcomes, restructure debt, refinance distressed companies, sell distressed companies, TAME‚Ñ¢, Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢, free cash flow model.

headline: Leadership Culture Consultant & Keynote Speaker | Building Cultures Where We Replace ME-pathy with EM-pathy ‚Üí To Build High-Trust, High-Performance Teams
summary: Leadership wasn‚Äôt built for a people-first focus. It‚Äôs time to re-engineer it. I help executives and organizations transform empathy from being seen as a ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù into a strategic leadership advantage. Using my ROE (Return on Empathy) framework, I turn Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) into Key People Indicators ‚Äì strengthening trust, accelerating decision-making, and improving business outcomes. The truth is, organizations rarely fail for lack of strategy; they struggle because people don‚Äôt feel safe, seen, or supported. Most leaders default to ME-pathy (‚Äúunderstand me, my intent, my stress‚Äù) without realizing it. True EM-pathy (‚Äúlet me understand you first‚Äù) drives psychological safety, retention, engagement, and innovation. My Mission To prove, with data and lived experience, that ROE is the new ROI. My Journey & Expertise I began life with a lesson in belonging -- adopted at three weeks old by parents who taught me worthiness, compassion, and unconditional love. Then came male-saturated industries where those traits weren‚Äôt always valued. I watched brilliant people burn out, values get compromised, and leaders rewarded for bureaucracy over bravery. headline: Humanizing Workplaces * Leadership & People Skills Expert * DiSC Certified * Keynote Speaker * Certified WBE, MBE, WOSB* #LatinaLeader #LeanInLatinas
summary: I help organizations create human-centered workplaces where everyone can thrive. I founded Talent and Genius with a simple but powerful insight: hidden talent abounds in every workplace, waiting to be discovered and developed. Throughout my journey, I've observed how building human-centered workplaces allows everyone to contribute their unique perspectives and abilities, creating environments where innovation thrives. My approach combines emotional intelligence, cultural competency, and a deep understanding of human nature to help people become more effective leaders, communicators, and self-advocates. With over 10,000 hours of experience as a consultant, coach, and facilitator, I've developed training and coaching programs that draw out the Deep Genius in professionals, helping them advance their careers, hone their leadership skills, and become powerful communicators. My team and I are on a mission to create workplaces where authenticity is celebrated, voices are amplified, and belonging is the norm. We're particularly skilled at helping organizations bridge communication gaps, build psychological safety, and develop leadership pipelines that embrace a multitude of thinking styles and backgrounds. Our client roster includes leaders in engineering, aerospace, tech, hospitality, government, non-profits, and global consulting ‚Äì from NASA to Microsoft to the University of California. We provide a comprehensive suite of services centered around the DiSC assessment, communication skills through a humanistic lens, coaching for leaders and managers, career advancement strategies for professionals from all backgrounds, and leadership development for emerging talent. Dubbed a "Professional Paradigm Shifter" and a "Geek Whisperer" (from the many STEM professionals I've helped), I've appeared in Forbes, The Huffington Post, Latina, Univision, Bay Area Focus, Smart Money, Redbook, and many popular podcasts. SPECIALTY AREAS ‚Ä¢ Certified Everything DiSC Facilitator and Authorized Partner ‚Ä¢ Communication Skills for Modern Workplaces ‚Ä¢ Coaching Skills for Leaders and Managers ‚Ä¢ Career Growth Strategies for Up and Coming Professionals ‚Ä¢ Leadership Development for High-Potential Talent An avid trivia nerd and unapologetic plant lover, I'm based in the redwood and oak filled hills of Oakland, CA. (Pacific Time Zone) My team and I work virtually and in person, providing support to private 1:1 clients and organizations. Find out more at https://TalentAndGenius.com

summary: As a respected strategic business leader, consultant, executive coach, and mental health advocate, I empower organizations and leaders to transform vision into reality while honoring the human experience at work. With 25+ years of experience across higher education, nonprofits, and corporate leadership, I have guided large-scale cultural transformations, advanced mental well-being initiatives, and built high-performing teams that thrive under complexity. My approach demonstrates what it means to walk the talk, creating trust and psychological safety from the top down. My commitment extends beyond the boardroom. I have served as a publicly elected trustee for a public school board of education, overseeing policy, data-driven governance, and community partnerships to support more than 16,000 students. As a change agent, I have led cross-sector task forces and strategic committees, aligning diverse stakeholders to drive forward impactful, mission-aligned initiatives. company_description: Tompkins Cortland Community College is one of 30 community colleges and 64 campuses in the State University of New York system. Located in Dryden, the college serves more than three thousand students in credit programs and another three thousand in non-credit workshops and customized training. The college offers more than 45 academic programs in business, computers, health, communications, liberal arts, criminal justice, and human services. Specific degree programs include broadcast production, computer forensics, engineering science, new media, sport management, hotel and restaurant management, wine marketing, and several liberal arts programs, including education and general studies. The college attracts a diverse student body from most counties in New York State, several other U.S. states, and nearly 70 countries. The learning environment is enriched by students of all ages and backgrounds. About half of the college's graduates transfer as juniors to bachelor's degree programs at a wide variety of colleges and universities around the world, including Cornell University and Ithaca College. TC3 students study both full-time and part-time, and the college is a leader in online education. The college operates extension centers in Ithaca and Cortland. TC3 is extensively involved in our community. The college provides contract training for most major employers and provides an array of non-credit workshops designed to build skills relating to computers, leadership and supervision, personal growth, and many other areas. As a learning-centered college, TC3 is strongly committed to building on strengths to achieve student success.

headline: Coach, Consultant, Facilitator
summary: I invite evolution. First for myself. For over 15 years, I have been supporting leadership and organizational development towards systems change, providing coaching, consultation, and facilitation around inner development, organizational alignment, strategic learning and evaluation, and policy/advocacy strategy development. I have worked internationally and domestically, with front-line staff to executives from nonprofits, philanthropy, healthcare organizations, collective impact initiatives, and educational institutions. I serve at the intersection of the multitude of our humanity and the complexity of our systems. I am grounded in the premise that systems change often happens through the personal transformation of its members. I am passionate about supporting greater insight, awareness, clarity, purpose, alignment, and courage for individuals and organizations. Attuned to personality patterns that make us uniquely human and cultural patterns that make us humankind, I am curious about eliciting the implicit value orientations that guide our attention, thinking and behavior. I am committed to examining systemic conditions while exploring new mindsets, power dynamics, and relationships to bring about a new reality. One of my great joys is to ask questions and hold space for discovery.

I‚Äôm drawn to roles and projects that combine leadership, mission, clarity, and service‚Äîespecially those that help people or organizations grow stronger in purpose. headline: I help operators and their teams make sense of AI | Former Chief of Staff and AI Lead at Quantive
summary: I help founders, operators, and their teams turn AI opportunity into capability. Here's what that looks like ‚Üì >> How it started: A few years ago my CEO said, "We need you to AI-ify this company." I was Chief of Staff. Not a developer. But I knew where the problems were. So I figured it out. Built things. Broke things. Built them better. >> What I learned: While the tech is (still) hard to wrap your head around, getting it to work as hoped and get the ROI you think it should comes from: 1. Understanding what AI can actually do (past the hype) 2. Finding the problems worth solving first 3. Building solutions people actually use >> Who I have helped: - Ops leaders at growth-stage startups - Founders building their first AI workflows for AI-first scaling - RevOps teams buried in manual work - Solopreneurs making AI useful for their business ...all spanning SaaS, talent & recruiting, real estate, non-profits, and more. >> The common thread? Pretty much the same thing every time. They see the AI opportunity. It's obvious something's there. But there's a gap between seeing it and actually using it. That's what I help close. >> How we work together: Learn (build your own capability): ‚Üí Follow along here - I share what's actually working for me and others! ‚Üí Subscribe to my newsletter - https://harrysiggins.substack.com/ ‚Üí Courses - see featured section for cohorts! ‚Üí Manual Override - an accelerator supporting solopreneurs and fractional execs in building AI-forward businesses (https://www.manualoverride.co/) Build (I work alongside you): ‚Üí Consulting projects (agents, workflows, and training) ‚Üí Retainers for ongoing build work and advisory >> What changes: You know what the before looks like. ! AI that seems impressive but doesn't apply to your work. ! A mental list of "try this" ideas that never go anywhere. ! Tools you've signed up for and stopped using. ! The feeling that everyone else figured this out already. That's the gap. Seeing the opportunity but not closing it. But once you do: * You know what AI can do for YOUR work in theory AND practice. * You have capability. Skills to do it yourself, systems I built with you, or both. * The next AI opportunity is easier to see and easier to act on because you've done it once now. * You're not someone who talks about AI anymore. You're someone who uses it. * You run an AI-first operation, team, and company. --- DM me or book a call: onetwogrowth.com

company_description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!

headline: Business Strategist | AI Roadmap Builder | Sustainability Maven | Funding Strategist | Technology Futurist | Public Speaker
summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn‚Äôt travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still ‚Äúgreen‚Äù? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in ‚Äúfood deserts‚Äù, meaning they don‚Äôt live near a grocery store. It‚Äôs not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I‚Äôm like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can ‚Äúsee‚Äù how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don‚Äôt excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

headline: Franchise Matchmaker | I uncover ‚ÄòBlue Ocean‚Äô franchises which are highly profitable, easy to set up and help you create financial freedom | Dozens of success stories, will you be next?
summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. headline: Revenue Operating Partner to Founders | I fix conversion and help teams close enterprise deals
summary: Most teams I work with don‚Äôt have a pipeline problem. They have a decision and conversion problem. Deals stall once they enter the organization. Champions lose momentum. Approvals slow. Revenue looks committed but never actually lands. Founders bring me in when that gap becomes visible and the business needs real revenue movement in the next 30 to 90 days, not another planning cycle. I operate as a Revenue Operating Partner. I work inside live deals, coaching founders and reps where decisions are breaking down, not periodically reviewing dashboards after the fact. Part founder advisor. Part deal strategist. Part GTM architect. How I help: ‚Ä¢ Diagnose where deals are truly failing: decision ownership, internal alignment, risk tolerance, or economic justification ‚Ä¢ Coach founders through commercial sequencing, trade-offs, and hard calls that teams avoid making‚Ä¢ Work directly inside active deals to equip champions with forwardable, CFO-ready business cases that survive executive scrutiny ‚Ä¢ Establish a simple operating rhythm that improves deal quality, speed, and predictability without adding process overhead Typical outcomes: ‚Ä¢ Six- and seven-figure opportunities reactivated after stalling‚Ä¢ Material reductions in deal cycle time once decision friction is addressed ‚Ä¢ Clear internal narratives that unlock approvals without escalation‚Ä¢ Founders regaining control of revenue conversations with boards and investors ‚Ä¢ Improved revenue execution preceding successful acquisitions I‚Äôm not a generic founder coach, and I‚Äôm not a fractional CRO. Those roles often diagnose problems after the window to act has passed. I specialize in one thing: Turning existing demand into closed revenue by fixing conversion at the point where decisions actually fail. If you‚Äôre carrying CEO and CRO responsibilities and deals are slowing inside the funnel, I help you make better revenue decisions and close what‚Äôs already on your desk.

previous_job_description: Who We Are: I founded the You Are a GIFT Foundation to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction and restore wholeness in their lives. After experiencing the personal loss of my daughter, I gained a profound perspective on what truly matters in life. This realization inspired a mission to provide mothers with the education, support, and resources they need to overcome addiction and rebuild their relationships and purpose. The foundation‚Äôs name, ‚ÄúGIFT,‚Äù reflects our core mission: to help individuals Reflect God‚Äôs Image and Fulfill their Talent in service to others. By empowering mothers to heal and thrive, we aim to glorify God through purposeful living. How We Help: At the You Are a GIFT Foundation, we focus on partnering with local organizations and nonprofits to address the unique challenges mothers face on the journey to becoming addiction-free. Through strategic collaborations, we provide: - Access to education and rehabilitation programs. - Tailored solutions to overcome obstacles preventing recovery. - Awareness campaigns to promote addiction prevention and family restoration. Our work is centered on offering a pathway for mothers to rebuild their lives, strengthen their families, and reclaim their purpose. Why We Exist: Prescription drug addiction often leaves mothers struggling to navigate the path to recovery alone. Our foundation exists to fill this gap by partnering with organizations to provide critical support, foster awareness, and pilot funding initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to empower mothers to overcome addiction, rebuild relationships with their families, and live meaningful, purpose-driven lives.

job_description: Founded and lead a national organization that creates and maintains an ecosystem that helps schools and districts recruit, retain, and retire Black male teachers, by cultivating the skills of Black males as early as kindergarten, and coordinating institutional pathways for them to matriculate to and through the profession.
company_description: Black male teachers have shown to have the greatest impact on student achievement. But, they make up only 1.3% of the profession. To shift this, we need an earlier start and longer support. We see today‚Äôs Black male students as tomorrow‚Äôs Black male teachers. Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.

headline: Fractional CFO (fCFO) | Growth Strategist | Relationship Cultivator | Helping CEOs Scale Smarter & Faster
summary: I started my career in merchant and investment banking. It was fast-paced and deal-driven, and I gained exposure to complex financial structures early on. But what always captured my attention wasn‚Äôt the capital side ‚Äî it was the operators. I was drawn to the builders, the entrepreneurs, the people in the trenches scaling something real. After working with several early-stage companies and briefly helping launch a hedge fund, I realized I loved the rhythm of small business ‚Äî but I needed more than passion; I needed process. A chance meeting with a seasoned fractional CFO and a copy of Traction by Gino Wickman opened my eyes. Finally, there was a framework that matched my instinct. In 2021, I joined a local firm in a junior CFO role. What began as a stepping stone quickly became a proving ground. I helped grow the client base, built internal systems, and took on leadership early. But like many entrepreneurial stories, what I helped build wasn‚Äôt mine to own. While at that firm, I met Chris Gauvin ‚Äî a Canadian, a CPA with a background in consulting and corporate finance. We couldn‚Äôt have had more different career paths. I came up through startups, Oklahoma State undergrad, and Dallas finance circles. He came through structured enterprise environments and had an MBA from the University of Texas. But we were in the same stage of life ‚Äî married, kids the same ages, both driven to build something lasting. That common ground ‚Äî vision, values, and a desire to finally have ownership in what we were building ‚Äî led us to launch Local Fractional. We built it for the founders we wish we‚Äôd served better before: the ones who need more than bookkeeping and backwards-looking reports. We offer nearshore-powered accounting foundations paired with strategic, fractional CFO leadership. We help you understand where you are AND where you‚Äôre going. We deliver monthly reports, KPI analysis, and forward-looking financial strategy ‚Äî but we don‚Äôt stop there. We‚Äôre building strategic AI tools that give founders 24/7 insight at their fingertips, because your best ideas don‚Äôt always come between 9 and 5. If you‚Äôre a founder building something real, we‚Äôd love to support your journey. -- If you want to go fast go alone, but if you want to go far go together --

summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. headline: Consultant, coach, mountaineer | I build client acquisition systems for small B2B firms
summary: By the age of 22, I'd: - Founded 4 businesses and sold 1 - Founded 2 non-profits and been program director at a 3rd - Directly mentored 300+ young entrepreneurs - Been appointed to faculty of an Ivy League University - Published 2 books Naturally, when I graduated from Brown, I had no interest in getting a job. But I had to make a living, so I founded a marketing agency. I worked with B2B service businesses, and promised them what everyone does. More marketing means: - More leads - More clients - More revenue Long story short, that didn't happen. I wasn't getting results because my approach was wrong. I noticed: Like most businesses, when B2B service firms want more clients, they invest in marketing. They chase cold leads, lose a ton of money, and wonder why nothing's working. So rather than being yet another run-of-the-mill marketing agency, I pivoted. Now, I build infrastructure to get more referrals. Why? It's the cheapest, fastest, and most effective way for a B2B service firm to grow. WHAT I BUILD: Referable Brand ‚Üí Positioning and messaging so clients know exactly who to refer to you Validation-Ready Digital Presence ‚Üí Website and LinkedIn optimized for referral confidence, not SEO traffic Relationship CRM ‚Üí Automated touchpoints that keep your network warm and generate systematic referrals WHO THIS IS FOR: Established B2B service firms ($500K-$5M) with 20+ client relationships but no system to leverage them. Consulting firms, agencies, coaches. WHY REFERRALS ARE BETTER: - They convert 71% higher than paid leads - They close 69% faster - Retention rates are 37% higher You might worry about being dependent on referrals. headline: Founder, Consultant and Coach at VirtueWorks, LLC | Citizen Journalist & Thought Champion at The LOVELY Project
summary: If you're reading this, you're curious. Curious people are intelligent people. I thrive on curiousity. My summary used to be the same-old rote descriptions of all the things I thought I was. It included words like "strategic", "collaborator", "leadership-driven", "people-centric", and so on‚Ä¶ I AM all those things but what about the PERSON behind the ROLE? Where did she go, I wonder? Well, a COMPLETE burnout in HR during the pandemic and two, yes two, subsequent layoffs in two years, I'm finally free of the constraints our modern workplace norms have become. I would now describe myself as a former Human Resource professional who woke up one day and had enough of the games, the politicking, working the grind for someone else only to be a cog in the wheel. It became untenable. I was reminded that we really can only control the "controllables"... ... how we respond to change, the integrity with which we handle ourselves, how we manage our home & finances, how we take care of and love those who we love, and ultimately where/when/how we steward the gifts and time we've been given. Jobs will come and go but who you are in the in-between matters most. I recently read a famous quote that made my stomach turn and my pulse race ..."The majority of people die at 35 but aren't buried until 75" - I see what this represents all around me and have my whole career. People on autopilot, no self-reflecting, not thriving, not clear on their God-given purpose and direction. I believe God wants better for you and for me. You have a LOVELY calling ... ready to discover what that is? Follow my journey: The Making of Something Lovely @ www.lovelycalling.com

I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.

headline: Fractional CMO | Business Growth Advisor | Business Coach | Strategy & Marketing Expert | Helping Professional Services & Consumer Brands Scale, Differentiate & Win
summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ‚úî Growth Strategy & Positioning ‚Äì Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ‚úî Leadership & Team Optimization ‚Äì Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ‚úî Sales & Marketing Acceleration ‚Äì Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ‚úî Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy ‚Äì Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ‚úî Exit & Transition Planning ‚Äì Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. REAL RESULTS, REAL IMPACT: ‚úÖ Transformed professional service firms by refining messaging, improving operations, and increasing client acquisition. ‚úÖ Led go-to-market strategies that drove multimillion-dollar growth for national and global consumer brands. ‚úÖ Revitalized declining industries through strategic branding and marketing that increased market share and profitability. ‚úÖ Helped business owners scale and exit by positioning their companies for sustainable growth and maximum valuation. LET'S CONNECT: I work with business owners through coaching, consulting, and fractional executive support. If you‚Äôre looking for an experienced partner to unlock the next level of growth, let‚Äôs start a conversation.

headline: Executive Coach ‚ô¶ Leadership Team Coach ‚ô¶ Speaker and Facilitator ‚ô¶ Non-Profit Board Leader and Founder
summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

headline: Most Businesses Rush to AI Before They‚Äôre Ready. I Fix That. | Author, ‚ÄúAligned Before AI‚Äù | Fractional Chief AI & Systems Officer | Building Structure Before Scale for Small Businesses & Nonprofits
summary: Most organizations are drowning in tools they don't need, solving for problems they haven't defined. I help small businesses and nonprofits get aligned before AI, build structure before scale, and create systems that serve people‚Äînot the other way around. THE PROBLEM Leaders buy systems before documenting their sales process. They buy automation before clarifying workflow. They chase AI before knowing what problems they're solving. Result? Expensive technology that creates chaos, not clarity. The tech industry profits from this confusion. I don't. ALIGNED BEFORE AI I published a book by this title because I'm tired of watching businesses waste money on premature technology. CLARITY BEFORE COMPLEXITY ‚Äì Before tools, we clarify what you're trying to accomplish. Until you can articulate this, no software will save you. STRUCTURE BEFORE SCALE ‚Äì You cannot automate chaos. If processes are broken, AI breaks them faster. We build documented workflows first, then introduce technology. HUMANS BEFORE HYPE ‚Äì AI amplifies what exists. Confused teams get more confused. Aligned teams become force multipliers. WHAT I'VE BUILT As Founder of Align & Innovate, I provide fractional Chief AI & Systems Officer services to organizations needing strategic technology leadership. Before that, I co-founded Visuals by Momo, helping 50+ nonprofits tell emotionally resonant stories through documentary productions. That taught me: the best technology means nothing if you can't tell a coherent story about what you do. I bring that lens to systems work. Every CRM, every workflow, every AI strategy‚Äîit's storytelling. I also host Visual Eyes Podcast, exploring storytelling, technology, and community impact. WHO I WORK WITH Leaders tired of tools that promise transformation but deliver headaches. Leaders ready to invest in foundational systems instead of chasing shiny objects. What I don't do: Sell software you don't need. Build AI that impresses investors but confuses teams. What I do: Ask hard questions. Design systems that reduce friction. Train teams to own tools‚Äînot be owned by them. MY CREDENTIALS ‚Ä¢ AI+ Chief AI Officer Certified ‚Ä¢ Board of Directors, HandsOn South Florida ‚Ä¢ Author: "Aligned Before AI" (Amazon, 2025) ‚Ä¢ Co-Founder, Visuals by Momo I don't sell what you don't need. I help you build what works. üìñ "Aligned Before AI" on Amazon üåê aligninnovate.com | visualsbymomo.com üìß chris@aligninnovate.com üéôÔ∏è Visual Eyes Podcast

headline: Chief Talent Architect | Talent Acquisition & Workforce Planner | Licensed Insurance & Benefits Agent | Maritime Industry Program Development | Small Business Owner | M.S. HR Leadership | Navy Veteran
summary: Welcome to my page! I am a make-it-happen strategic workforce development leader and Navy Veteran passionate about connecting mission-ready talent with high-impact opportunities in civilian industry. I currently serve as a workforce development connector across Illinois and Minnesota ‚Äî playing a pivotal role in revitalizing the maritime manufacturing sector by strengthening talent pipelines, expanding regional workforce capacity, and aligning employer needs with ready, capable professionals. At Return to Home Port¬Æ, a strategic management services firm, we are focused on bridging the military-to-civilian transition, I help connect employers with military-connected talent, navigate workforce programs and certifications, and design deliberate strategies that maximize organizational and individual outcomes. We use proprietary planning and analytical methodologies to foster meaningful relationships between employers and military-trained talent, unlocking value for businesses and transitioning service members alike. In my professional journey, I proudly served in the U.S. Navy ‚Äî an experience that instilled in me a deeply rooted commitment to leadership, disciplined execution, and mission focus. Building on that foundation, I earned my Master of Science in Human Resources Leadership from West Virginia University, equipping me with advanced expertise in talent strategy, organizational development, and people-centered solutions. I went on to found an HR Consultancy - Cappellos Holdings (DBA Cappellos HR Solutions) and boot strapped $500k of professional services in my first two years of business as a single owner and operator. I have delivered business management solutions for several Fortune 100, 500, and 1000 U.S. based companies and recently entered the world of government contracting. Across both public and private sectors, I specialize in workforce ecosystem development that accelerates growth, fosters inclusive talent pipelines, and strengthens the industrial base ‚Äî particularly in maritime manufacturing. I partner with educational institutions, employers, and workforce organizations to advance opportunities that help regions compete, innovate, and sustain long-term success. Let‚Äôs connect if you share an interest in talent strategy, veteran employment, maritime workforce development, or organizational transformation.

The World Bank estimates that 40 percent of the global population lives in places of high vulnerability to climate change. "Business as usual" investing could put asset owners at risk of not meeting their fiduciary responsibilities, being misaligned with rapidly evolving regulations/guidelines or simply being out of touch with their stakeholders‚Äô sustainability convictions. I am the professional you can partner with and trust on your transition from the Institutional Investor you are to the Responsible Institutional Investor you aim to become. 1-Expertise and Experience: I am a qualified actuary (FCIA, FSA) and Chartered Investment Manager (CIM) with expertise in pension plan governance, funding, investing, ESG integration and management of climate-related risks and opportunities. My clients value my honest communication, my creative thinking, and my rigorous analysis. headline: Attorney | Organizational Consultant | Leadership Coach ‚Ä¢ Empowering Leaders & Organizations
summary: Dru is a high-energy presenter, leading advisor, and seasoned strategist with extensive experience in law, diversity & inclusion, advocacy, policy, and philanthropy. A recognized leader in the LGBTQ+ equality movement for more than 25 years, he now leads his own coaching and consulting practice, Dru Levasseur Consulting, LLC, and facilitates the Trans Legal Professionals Networking Program, a network of trans judges, law students, lawyers, and business professionals. He previously served as the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion for the National LGBTQ+ Bar, creating and leading its DEI Consulting Practice, the first LGBTQ+ inclusion coaching and consulting program designed specifically to enable the implementation of best practice standards for LGBTQ+ equity in the legal profession. He directed Lambda Legal's Transgender Rights Project from 2009 to 2019, attending the first transgender policy meeting at the White House in 2011, and serving as counsel in landmark impact litigation cases and amicus briefs in federal courts, including the U.S. Supreme Court. He co-founded a national trans-led nonprofit, the Jim Collins Foundation, and currently serves alongside Gloria Steinem and other notable feminists as Vice-Chair for the ERA Coalition. A national and international media spokesperson, Dru has appeared in the New York Times, the Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, Associated Press, People Magazine, Self, Reuters, ABC, CBS, NBC, CNN, ABA Journal, Atlantic, Vice, Daily News, New York Post, USA Today, the Chicago Tribune, Fox News, NPR, Huffington Post, and was profiled in the Advocate and Vanguard Law Magazine. Dru contributed the chapter, ‚ÄúYour Authenticity is Your Power: Tales of a Trans Lawyer‚Äù in the 2023 book, Surviving Transphobia. Harvard Law School selected him as a Wasserstein Fellow for the 2021-2022 academic year. He is admitted in New York, Georgia, D.C., and Massachusetts.

headline: On-Demand HR Partner for Skilled Trades | Practical HR Support for Small, Growing Trades Businesses | I Help Make HR Simple, Clear & Manageable
summary: I‚Äôve spent my entire career inside HR. But the people I care about most aren‚Äôt sitting in corporate boardrooms. They‚Äôre running skilled trades and service businesses. They‚Äôre out in the field early, managing crews, juggling schedules, solving problems in real time ‚Äî and doing everything they can to keep the work moving and their people supported. And almost every one of them has said some version of the same thing to me: ‚ÄúI know HR matters‚Ä¶ I just don‚Äôt have the time. And honestly, I‚Äôm not even sure where to start.‚Äù That‚Äôs exactly why I founded On Demand HR Solutions. Small, growing trades businesses don‚Äôt need corporate HR theory or overbuilt policies that don‚Äôt fit how the work actually gets done. They need simple, practical HR support ‚Äî delivered in a way that works alongside the business, not on top of it. That‚Äôs where I come in. I work as an independent on-demand HR partner for skilled trades businesses, and I offer a few clear ways to get support, depending on what you need right now: HR SOS Session A focused, one-hour working session to tackle one specific HR issue ‚Äî a people problem, compliance question, hiring concern, or ‚Äúthis just came up and I need help‚Äù situation. HR Blueprint A short-term, hands-on engagement to put the HR foundations in place ‚Äî clear policies, better hiring and onboarding, and simple systems that bring structure and consistency to how you manage your crew. HR Advisory Ongoing HR support for owners who want a trusted partner in their corner ‚Äî someone they can call, message, or loop in when questions come up, decisions need to be made, or issues start to surface. No over-engineered solutions. No corporate speak. No judgment. Just honest, practical HR support designed for businesses where the work happens in the field. I believe HR should make running a business easier ‚Äî not harder. If you‚Äôre not sure which option makes sense, that‚Äôs okay. Most people aren‚Äôt. Send me a message here on LinkedIn and tell me what‚Äôs going on. I‚Äôll help you figure out the simplest next step. üì• Message me on LinkedIn ‚Äî I‚Äôm just one DM away.

job_description: After more than 30 years leading HR in complex corporate environments, I started noticing a pattern. Small, growing skilled trades businesses were being asked to manage the same HR responsibilities: hiring, onboarding, safety, compliance, employee issues ‚Äî without the time, support, or internal HR teams that larger companies rely on. Most owners don't want to ‚Äúdo HR.‚Äù They just wanted the work to run smoothly, their crews supported, and their business protected. So I founded On Demand HR Solutions to meet them where they are. Today, I work as an on-demand HR partner for skilled trades and field-based businesses, helping owners put practical HR systems in place that actually work in real life. My focus is HR operations and people management that supports how trades businesses run day to day. That includes everything from hiring and onboarding crews, to setting clear expectations, handling employee issues, and staying compliant as the business grows. I step in where HR usually falls through the cracks and help bring structure, clarity, and consistency without overcomplicating things. What this looks like in practice: - Acting as the HR department for small trades businesses, providing on-demand guidance, HR administration, and compliance support - Supporting owners through sensitive employee relations issues with a balance of compassion, clarity, and compliance - Building right-sized HR foundations ‚Äî handbooks, policies, onboarding processes, and basic systems that crews can actually follow - Providing fractional or interim HR support when a business needs experienced HR leadership without hiring full-time - Helping owners move from reactive, day-to-day people issues to more stable, repeatable ways of managing their teams This work allows me to do what I care about most: Making HR feel manageable for business owners who already have enough on their plates ‚Äî and helping trades businesses grow without the constant stress of ‚Äúfiguring it out as they go.‚Äù

previous_job_title: HR Leadership Roles (Head of Global HR Service Delivery, Head of HR - Corporate, HR Manager)
previous_job_description: While my title at Integra LifeSciences changed over 16 years, the constant was transformation. Integra‚Äôs growth-by-acquisition strategy meant the business‚Äîand HR‚Äîwere always evolving. Every acquisition brought new people, systems, and challenges, giving me the opportunity to reinvent HR over and over again. It often felt like working for a dozen companies within one. In my final role as Head of Global HR Service Delivery, I built and led what became the one-stop-shop for employee support across payroll, benefits, onboarding, leave of absence, employee relations and more. I launched ServiceNow globally, to streamline employee inquiries, reducing response times to under 24 hours, and creating a single source of truth for HR processes. This work supported a dynamic, fast-scaling organization where clear, efficient HR processes were critical. But beyond the systems and processes, what I‚Äôm most proud of is how we made HR approachable again‚Äîturning a fragmented, confusing experience into one where employees felt supported and leaders had the tools they needed to lead confidently. Earlier, as Head of HR for Corporate Functions, I served as the executive HR partner to C-Suite Finance, IT, Legal, Business Development, and Scientific leaders‚Äîsupporting them through organization design, restructuring, and workforce planning. I helped leaders build talent strategies, navigate organizational changes, and integrate acquired teams seamlessly into the business. As HR Manager, I supported global operations, quality, regulatory, and commercial sales teams, leading recruitment and retention strategies, launching training programs, and guiding leaders through performance management and employee relations issues. Integra was where I learned to thrive in ambiguity, manage change without losing sight of people, and ensure HR always aligned with the evolving needs of the business.

summary: I am a founder and agile strategist at Loghan Partners, a consulting firm that helps clients achieve organizational growth and transformation through agile principles and practices. I have over 15 years of experience in leading and coaching agile teams, delivering customer-centric products and services, helping cultures in transition, and facilitating process improvement and innovation. As an agile practitioner, I have a proven track record of building relationships within and between units, creating and sharing a common high-level vision, and aligning it with the details of day-to-day work. I have worked with clients from diverse industries and sectors, such as Energy, Consulting, Fortune 100, and higher education, in the US and overseas. I am passionate about enabling teams to adapt, prioritize, and collaborate effectively, using tools such as Jira Align, Agile Maturity Assessments, and Product Mindset Training.
